Roughening Heston
abstract: Rough volatility models are known to fit the volatility surface remarkably well with very few parameters. On the other hand, the classical Heston model is highly tractable allowing for fast calibration. We present here the rough Heston model which offers the best of both worlds. Even better, we find that we can accurately approximate rough Heston model values by scaling the volatility of volatility parameter of the classical Heston model.

title: Affine Rough Models
abstract: The goal of this survey article is to explain and elucidate the affine structure of recent models appearing in the rough volatility literature, and show how it leads to exponential-affine transform formulas
